meanings.definition: Transported by a different route or carrier than the original shipment.
meanings.sent1: The backhauled package arrived safely despite the change in transportation.
meanings.sent2: The backhauled goods were delivered efficiently using an alternate route.
meanings.sent3: The backhauled items took a detour but still reached their destination on time.
meanings.sent4: The backhauled supplies made a surprising journey before reaching their final destination.
meanings.sent5: The backhauled cargo traveled through unexpected paths but reached its destination successfully.

meanings.definition: To transport goods or data back to a central location.
meanings.sent1: They backhauled the equipment to the main office for maintenance.
meanings.sent2: The company backhauled the data to the headquarters for analysis.
meanings.sent3: He backhauled the lost files to the central server with ease.
meanings.sent4: She backhauled the products to the warehouse for storage.
meanings.sent5: The team backhauled the supplies to the central hub efficiently.

meanings.definition: The act of moving something back to its original location.
meanings.sent1: The backhauled of the equipment was necessary to restore the setup.
meanings.sent2: The backhauled of the items helped in organizing the inventory.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected backhauled of the goods caused a bit of confusion.
meanings.sent4: The quick backhauled of the materials saved time and effort.
meanings.sent5: The smooth backhauled of the products improved the workflow.
